page.title: 15THE VILLAGE POLICEMAN
page.content: P.C.99 has been a policeman for nearly 25 years. He lives in a police_house in the centre of the village of Horseheath, although he is based at Linton Station.He works 8 hour shifts, and averages a 40 hour week. He says the 'pros' of being a police officer are"The money is quite good, it is pensionable after 25 years , and the accommodation is free. The disadvantages are basically the unsociable working hours."P.C.99 reports that Horseheath is a very pleasant village to live in, and people treat him as a friend and neighbour. His two teenage daughters however, find it boring, with not enough to do in the area.He has only chased anyone as a traffic officer, has used his handcuffs very seldom, but has made several arrests during his career.
